section.ja: 病院 歯科系診療部門 口・顎の外科

department.en: Graduate School, Division of Dental Research

paper_title.ja: Experimental Study on Healing of Bone Implants Treated by Heating or Freezing
paper_title.en: Experimental Study on Healing of Bone Implants Treated by Heating or Freezing.(jointly worked)

description.ja: The aim of this study was to assess the healing response to the bone implants treated by heating or freezing. Allogenic calvarial implants treated by heating at 65℃ for 1 hour, 3 freezes of 3 minutes, or boiling for 10 minutes (65℃, frozen and boiled group respectively) were tested for the potential to fill cranial bone defects of rabbits. Both the 65℃ and frozen groups similarly showed more than 60% of new bone formation in terms of the untreated control. Among the three treatment modalities, boiling presented the most remarkable impairment on the reparative capacity of the implants. The autogenous bone segments reimplanted to their original mandibular sites after treatment by heating at 65℃ using microwave or by freezing were revealed to similarly incorporate to the host bone in dog experiments. In summary, heat treatment at 65℃ for 1 hour is comparable with freeze treatment in terms of preservation of the regenerative potential of bone for simultaneous reimplantation.
description.en: The aim of this study was to assess the healing response to the bone implants treated by heating or freezing. Allogenic calvarial implants treated by heating at 65℃ for 1 hour, 3 freezes of 3 minutes, or boiling for 10 minutes (65℃, frozen and boiled group respectively) were tested for the potential to fill cranial bone defects of rabbits. Both the 65℃ and frozen groups similarly showed more than 60% of new bone formation in terms of the untreated control. Among the three treatment modalities, boiling presented the most remarkable impairment on the reparative capacity of the implants. The autogenous bone segments reimplanted to their original mandibular sites after treatment by heating at 65℃ using microwave or by freezing were revealed to similarly incorporate to the host bone in dog experiments. In summary, heat treatment at 65℃ for 1 hour is comparable with freeze treatment in terms of preservation of the regenerative potential of bone for simultaneous reimplantation.

paper_title.en: Enhancement of the photodynamic antitumor effect by streptococcal preparation OK-432 in the mouse carcinoma.(jointly worked)
Enhanced Cell Death in NR-Sl Tumor by Photodynamic Therapy : Possible Involvement of Fas and Fas liqand System(jointly worked)
Promotional effects of CO2 laser and scalpe incision of 4-NQO induced premalignant lesions of mouse tongue(jointly worked)
Effect of photodynamic therap using 5-aminolevulinic acid on 4-nitroquinoline -1-oxide-induced premalignant and malignant lesion of mouse tongue(jointly worked)
Cell kinetics of mouse tumour aubjected to photodynamic therapy evaluation by proliferating cell nuclear antigen immunohistochemistry(jointly worked)
Assessment of growth potential by MIB-1 immunohistochemistry in ameloblastic fibroma and related lesions of the jaws compared with ameloblastic fibrosarcoma

description.en: Specimens from two ameloblastic fibromas (including one recurrent case), two ameloblastic fibro-odontomas, and one ameloblastic fibrosarcoma were subjected to investigation by MIB-1 immunohistochemistry in order to elucidate the growth potential of these tumors. MIB-1 labeling indices in the epithelial component of these tumors ranged from 2.9 to 7.5%, whereas those in the mesenchymal component ranged from 1.5 to 13.5%. Of these, labeling indices in the mesenchymal component of the recurrent ameloblastic fibroma and ameloblastic fibrosarcoma were quite high. These findings suggest that evaluation of growth potential in ameloblastic fibroma and related lesions could be of help in understanding tumor aggressiveness and in selecting appropriate surgical procedures.

paper_title.ja: ヘマトポルフィリンオリゴマーを用いた光化学治療後のマウス腫瘍細胞の電子顕微鏡観察
paper_title.en: Electron Microscopic Study on Mouse Tumor Cell Following Photodynamic Therapy with Hematoporphyrin Oligomers

description.ja:
A new photosensitizer Hematoporphyrin Oligomers (HpO) based photodynamic therapy (PDT) on mouse squamous cell carcinoma was studied.
Morphological changes of the tumor after PDT was investigated by a transmission electron microscopy. One hour after PDT, bullous mitochondria were seen with irregular shaped inner cristae. After six hours, the inner cristae and outer membrane of mitochondria disappeared. Endonucleus vesicles appeared. Heterochromatin increased in the nucleus. Forty-eight hours later, mitochondria had no longer its original feature. The outer layer of plasma membrane vanished away.
Our study concludes that target organ HpO based PDT seems to be mitochondria.
description.en:
A new photosensitizer Hematoporphyrin Oligomers (HpO) based photodynamic therapy (PDT) on mouse squamous cell carcinoma was studied.
Morphological changes of the tumor after PDT was investigated by a transmission electron microscopy. One hour after PDT, bullous mitochondria were seen with irregular shaped inner cristae. After six hours, the inner cristae and outer membrane of mitochondria disappeared. Endonucleus vesicles appeared. Heterochromatin increased in the nucleus. Forty-eight hours later, mitochondria had no longer its original feature. The outer layer of plasma membrane vanished away.
Our study concludes that target organ HpO based PDT seems to be mitochondria.

paper_title.ja: Immunohistochemical Study on Epithelialization of the Fascial Flap in the Oral Cavity of Rats
paper_title.en: Immunohistochemical study on epithelialization of the fascial flap in the oral cavity of rats(jointly worked)

description.ja: The immunohistochemical expressions of epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) and Proliferating Cell Nuclear Antigen (PCNA) were studied in the epithelialization process of bare flaps, the fascial flap and the deepithelialized mucoperiosteal flap, used for reconstruction of the oral mucosa in rat models. The intense expression of EGFR and PCNA was detected in the tip area of the migrating epithelium during the early period of the healing process in both flaps, and differing distributions of EGFR and PCNA positive cells were identified. In the fascial flap, a significantly high positive rate of EGFR was detected in comparison with the deepithelialized mucoperiosteal flap. The expression of EGFR in both flaps may be attributed to the influences of different connective tissue substrates which induce a control mechanism to maintain the equilibrium between differentiation and proliferation of epithelium.
description.en: The immunohistochemical expressions of epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) and Proliferating Cell Nuclear Antigen (PCNA) were studied in the epithelialization process of bare flaps, the fascial flap and the deepithelialized mucoperiosteal flap, used for reconstruction of the oral mucosa in rat models. The intense expression of EGFR and PCNA was detected in the tip area of the migrating epithelium during the early period of the healing process in both flaps, and differing distributions of EGFR and PCNA positive cells were identified. In the fascial flap, a significantly high positive rate of EGFR was detected in comparison with the deepithelialized mucoperiosteal flap. The expression of EGFR in both flaps may be attributed to the influences of different connective tissue substrates which induce a control mechanism to maintain the equilibrium between differentiation and proliferation of epithelium.

paper_title.ja: 口腔扁平上皮癌における腫瘍マーカーおよびADCC活性の臨床的検討
paper_title.en: Clinical evaluation of tumor markers and antibody-dependent cell-mediated cytotoxicity in patients with oral squamous cell carcinoma

description.ja:
Peripheral squamous cell carcinoma related antigen (SCC), tissue polypeptide antigen (TPA), immunosuppressive acidic protein (IAP), carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA), and antibody-dependent cell-mediated cytotoxicity (ADCC) were measured in patients with oral squamous cell carcinoma (n=44), before and after treatment in order to clarify the clinical significance of these tumor markers.
In this study, SCC, TPA, IAP, and CEA correlated with progression of the disease. Among these tumor markers, IAP showed the strongest correlation with progression of cancer. It seems to be one of the useful markers for cancer screening or monitoring, although the differential diagnosis must include inflammatory diseases. We regard multidisciplinary treatment to be necessary in patients with high TPA levels.
description.en:
Peripheral squamous cell carcinoma related antigen (SCC), tissue polypeptide antigen (TPA), immunosuppressive acidic protein (IAP), carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA), and antibody-dependent cell-mediated cytotoxicity (ADCC) were measured in patients with oral squamous cell carcinoma (n=44), before and after treatment in order to clarify the clinical significance of these tumor markers.
In this study, SCC, TPA, IAP, and CEA correlated with progression of the disease. Among these tumor markers, IAP showed the strongest correlation with progression of cancer. It seems to be one of the useful markers for cancer screening or monitoring, although the differential diagnosis must include inflammatory diseases. We regard multidisciplinary treatment to be necessary in patients with high TPA levels.

paper_title.ja: エナメル質脱灰製溝のin vitro耐酸性におよぼすレーザー照射の影響
上顎に発生した悪性線維性組織球腫の1例
paper_title.en: A case of malignant fibrous histiocytoma in the maxilla

description.ja:
Malignant fibrous histiocytoma (MFH) is a mesenchymal tumor rarely found in the maxilla, and its prognosis is very poor. We report a case of MFH arising in the right maxilla of a patient who has survived for a prolonged period after tumorectomy.
A 78-year-old man was referred to our department because of a mass in the right palatal region. Initial biopsy examination revealed a sarcoma; however, the histological type was unable to be determined. On immunohistochemical and transmission electron microscopic examination of a second biopsy specimen, a diagnosis of MFH was made. Continuous arterial infusion of 5 -FU and external irradiation with Co60-γ rays were given preoperatively. After chemotherapy and radiotherapy, the size of the tumor mass decreased. The tumor was excised with a partial maxillectomy. Thers is no clinical evidence of recurrence as of 8.5 years postoperatively.
description.en:
Malignant fibrous histiocytoma (MFH) is a mesenchymal tumor rarely found in the maxilla, and its prognosis is very poor. We report a case of MFH arising in the right maxilla of a patient who has survived for a prolonged period after tumorectomy.
A 78-year-old man was referred to our department because of a mass in the right palatal region. Initial biopsy examination revealed a sarcoma; however, the histological type was unable to be determined. On immunohistochemical and transmission electron microscopic examination of a second biopsy specimen, a diagnosis of MFH was made. Continuous arterial infusion of 5 -FU and external irradiation with Co60-γ rays were given preoperatively. After chemotherapy and radiotherapy, the size of the tumor mass decreased. The tumor was excised with a partial maxillectomy. Thers is no clinical evidence of recurrence as of 8.5 years postoperatively.

paper_title.en: Tumor destruction and proliferation Kinetics following perlodic low power light, hematoporphyrin oligomers mediated photodynamic therapy in the mouse tongue.

paper_title.ja: ヘマトポルフィリンオリゴマーとパルスレーザー光を利用した光化学治療法の基礎的研究
paper_title.en: Basic Studies on the Photodynamic Therapy with Hematoporphyrin Oligomers and Pulsed Laser.

description.ja:
Hematoporphyrin derivatives (HpD) has been utilized as a photosensitizer in photodynamic therapy (PDT). HpD is a mixture of different kinds of perphyrins and whose photoactive component seems to be a dimer or an oligomer.
In this study basic PDT experiments were carried out in vitro and in vivo using the hematoporphyrin oligomers (Hp oligomers) as photosensitizers and pulsed Nd-YAG dye laser as the light source.
In vitro, the Hp oligomers and HpD in 90% methanol solution were compared in their triplet-triplet (T-T) absorption spectra and the life duration of their triplet states. Fluorescence was detected from Raji cells which were coincubated with either Hp oligomers or HpD. Their cytotoxic effect in Raji cells were also compared after laser irradiation.
The intensity of fluorescence was detected in vivo, in normal and tumor bearing areas of C3H/He mouse injected with Hp oligomers 48 hours later. The photonecrotic effects on the tumor were investigated after PDT.
The results obtained are as follows:
1) T-T absorption spectra of the two photosensitizers showed nearly identical patterns. The life duration of the Hp oligomers' triplet state was 3 times longer than HpD.
2) The longer each of the photosensitizers was coincubated, the more it was accumulated in the Raji cells. The cytotoxic effect of Hp oligomers was higher than HpD.
3) Photonecrosis induced by PDT occurred in about 87% of the tumor mass. Histological findings suggested that tumor vasculature is affected by PDT.
description.en:
Hematoporphyrin derivatives (HpD) has been utilized as a photosensitizer in photodynamic therapy (PDT). HpD is a mixture of different kinds of perphyrins and whose photoactive component seems to be a dimer or an oligomer.
In this study basic PDT experiments were carried out in vitro and in vivo using the hematoporphyrin oligomers (Hp oligomers) as photosensitizers and pulsed Nd-YAG dye laser as the light source.
In vitro, the Hp oligomers and HpD in 90% methanol solution were compared in their triplet-triplet (T-T) absorption spectra and the life duration of their triplet states. Fluorescence was detected from Raji cells which were coincubated with either Hp oligomers or HpD. Their cytotoxic effect in Raji cells were also compared after laser irradiation.
The intensity of fluorescence was detected in vivo, in normal and tumor bearing areas of C3H/He mouse injected with Hp oligomers 48 hours later. The photonecrotic effects on the tumor were investigated after PDT.
The results obtained are as follows:
1) T-T absorption spectra of the two photosensitizers showed nearly identical patterns. The life duration of the Hp oligomers' triplet state was 3 times longer than HpD.
2) The longer each of the photosensitizers was coincubated, the more it was accumulated in the Raji cells. The cytotoxic effect of Hp oligomers was higher than HpD.
3) Photonecrosis induced by PDT occurred in about 87% of the tumor mass. Histological findings suggested that tumor vasculature is affected by PDT.
